page.title: 03ERDINTON DISTRICT
page.content: The area was chiefly agricultural land before 1910, producing both root and cereal crops. After the middle of the nineteenth century the village of Erdington started to grow rapidly and gradually agricultural land was swallowed up. Today the area is largely suburbs consisting of a variety of housing including modern, private and council estates but with some houses surviving from the turn of the century. The older houses are chiefly along the main roads from the City, Slade Road, George Road, Gravelly Hill and some in what was the centre of the Village of Erdington. There is no heavy industry in the area but there are a number of good shopping centres and other facilities.
